bioghist.p: Ceil Smith Thayer was a graduate of the Fawcett School of the Industrial Arts and a postgraduate student at the New York School of Fine and Applied Arts. She held various production positions in advertising agencies and department stores in New York City from 1922-1928. After that, she held positions involving art in the corporate and publishing worlds. Later, Thayer collected boxes of material relating to watermarks toward her research on a book on the subject.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of research materials collected by Ceil Smith Thayer related to papermaking and watermarks. Materials include; research notebooks, slides, paper and watermark samples, typescripts and printed articles, and correspondence. Of particular interest is the correspondence with Kathryn and Howard Clark of Twinrocker.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
